Unapologetics

Homesick

Mar 3, 2020

by Chris Carter


With empty strength
Grievous branches fracture the sky
To murmur warnings.


Mankind sighs like the trees
As he wistfully sojourns for all of his lifeless days.
Even in the grave his ache is not soothed.


Where is man’s home?
The whole world groans:
“Not here, and not there either”.
